title: Mission Description
content: Gallagher gestures for everyone to adjourn the discussion to somewhere else. He brings you to the Dreamjolt Hostelry — A quiet and ordinary corner in this frolicking dream.

line: What brings you here, Gallagher?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Some friends from the old days. Do you have a moment to spare, Siobhan ?

speaker: Siobhan
line: I have the whole day to spare. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to Dreamjolt Hostelry!

speaker: Siobhan
line: This bar offers a wide variety of drinks, but we draw the line at SoulGlad . Why settle for ordinary when you can experience extraordinary? We're dedicated to serving up nothing but pure joy and laughter.

speaker: Siobhan
line: What would you like to drink? I'll whip it up for you.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Look, (Trailblazer)! A lady as cool as Serval !

speaker: Siobhan
line: Who's Serval? Will you introduce me to her?

speaker: March 7th
line: Oops, she's heard us...

speaker: Gallagher
line: Just spare them, my esteemed bartender. I'll take over the bar today.

speaker: Gallagher
line: I'm getting up there in age, and I need some practice before I forget the skills that used to put food on my table. Where did you stash the ingredients?

speaker: Siobhan
line: They're all under the counter. Since our guests have traveled from afar, shouldn't you whip up some special drinks?

speaker: Gallagher
line: That's exactly what I had in mind. Hey, my friends, do me a favor. Go around the bar and bring me any ingredients you fancy.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The discussion might take quite some time, so I'll prepare some customized, non-alcoholic drinks for you.

speaker: March 7th
line: In the bar? But aren't all the ingredients right there on the counter?

speaker: Siobhan
line: Why, we're in a dream, my lovely lady. You can help yourself to anything if you wish for it — comfort, hunger, confusion, or even boredom... It's all within reach, right at your fingertips.

speaker: March 7th
line: Did you hear that! She just called me "my lovely lady"...!

speaker: Gallagher
line: Even in reality, mixing drinks is more than just throwing ingredients together. A bartender needs to capture the bar's atmosphere, master technique, and spin a tale of mystery and anticipation...

speaker: Siobhan
line: Only then can a perfect drink, crafted with the customer's life story, be created.

speaker: Gallagher
line: In other words, what you get from your drink is down to luck. So don't overthink it. Indecisiveness has no place when it comes to enjoyment.

title: Step Description
content: Gallagher gestures for everyone to adjourn the discussion to somewhere else. He brings you to the Dreamjolt Hostelry — A quiet and ordinary corner in this frolicking dream. Considering the complexity of the cases, he decides to showcase his skills by preparing special drinks to keep everyone entertained. Otherwise, the negotiation process would be too boring. It will be dull if you have to spend the next 20 minutes listening to stories with no gameplay!You can explore the Dreamjolt Hostelry for ingredients. Gallagher will then use magic to make perfect concoctions out of them.

speaker: Siobhan
line: And let me tell you, don't underestimate the bartenders of Penacony , especially not Gallagher. This guy is pure magic... He can satisfy even the pickiest of customers.

speaker: Siobhan
line: Don't go easy on this old man. Give him a real challenge.

speaker: Gallagher
line: That being said, mixing a drink is way simpler than you'd imagine. Just pick your favorite ingredients, toss them in a glass, mix it up, and it's done.

speaker: Gallagher
line: So go ahead, explore the bar and bring me any ingredients you prefer.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Go ahead, my friend. I'm sure you'll find splendid ingredients.

speaker: March 7th
line: Can this be used for mixing drinks? Oh, and there's a note underneath... "Exchange with your precious things."

speaker: March 7th
line: What should we exchange for it?... And who should we give our stuff to?

children.text: You put "Praise of High Morals" into the empty cup in a metaphysical manner...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...Whoa, the words on the note are changing!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: "Happiness belongs to the noble." Does this mean we can take it? Ahaha, doing good deeds does pay off! Thank you!

children.text: You put 50,000 credits into the empty cup

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...Whoa, the words on the note are changing!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: "Stairs made of coins can lead to happiness." Does this mean we can take it? I'm not sure if it's a good deal... but thank you anyway!

children.text: You put a bag of trash into the empty cup

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hey, what are you doing! You can't just throw trash... No way! The words on the note are changing!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: "Happiness is the dream of the humble." Does this mean we can take it? Something feels weird about this...

text: There doesn't seem to be anything that can be put in...
(Investigate bottles on the bar counter left of Gallagher)

speaker: March 7th
line: Check out this bottle. The liquid inside looks beautiful, and the label reads... Dream Syrup (Thick). I don't see an expiration date, but the production date is...

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Half an Amber Era ago?

speaker: March 7th
line: Drinking this stuff can't lead to anything good. That's for sure...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Ugh... the syrup has turned clumpy... I definitely don't want to drink this even if it's not expired.

text: But I thought we could drink anything in dreams?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: That's true, but this... really doesn't seem fresh...

speaker: Siobhan
line: Did you find the bottle of syrup I've been hoarding? Don't worry, it's all just a dream, and it won't upset your stomach. It's been aging for years, and should have a refined taste by now. Feel free to have some. It's perfect for entertaining lovely guests like you.

speaker: March 7th
line: Then... we'll keep it for now...

speaker: March 7th
line: It's SoulGlad! But I thought they didn't sell SoulGlad at the bar?

speaker: March 7th
line: Let's give it a shake! Nice, it's still fizzy and has a long shelf life!

text: Maybe someone else brought it here.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: That's possible. You see SoulGlad everywhere these days, so it wouldn't be a surprise if someone brought a bottle here.

text: Maybe it's placed here for decoration.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Yeah, perhaps. SoulGlad is a classic in Penacony, and it'd be strange for a bar not to have it.

text: Don't! It's no good for our drink if all shaken up.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Uh-huh! I... Let's just leave it here for a while... and it'll be alright, right?

speaker: March 7th
line: Why don't they sell SoulGlad in this bar? Did something happen?

speaker: Himeko
line: It's all about the bartender's pride. It wouldn't make sense for customers to come here and order drinks they can find anywhere else. That's the mindset I use when I brew my coffee.

speaker: March 7th
line: Um... Haha, you're right, Himeko.

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, look at all these chips scattered everywhere...

speaker: Gallagher
line: A few days ago, an actor from the Iris Family came — caused a ruckus with Siobhan... Those chips must have gotten scattered during all the chaos.

text: I can only imagine how intense that scene must have been.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Nah, it turned out to be a landslide victory.

text: So, enemies drop gold coins even in a dream?

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Haha, that's a clever metaphor.

speaker: March 7th
line: That being said, opening a bar in this place... filled with monsters... is quite a feat. Siobhan must have a lot of tricks up her sleeve, right?

speaker: Gallagher
line: You'll have to ask her yourself to find out. But I have a feeling she won't budge unless you impress her with an incredible drink.

speaker: Siobhan
line: Haven't I made myself clear enough, Ms. Amiky? The Dreamjolt Hostelry only welcomes guests who want to enjoy a drink to their heart's content. I'm sorry, but I'm not interested in your proposal.

speaker: Amiky
line: But you have the talent! You'll attract a huge audience... You're destined for the Iris' stage, not for this run-down shack!

speaker: Amiky
line: Come with me! We'll become the talk of Penacony, shining light into every corner of the Dreamscape! Please, Siobhan, I really need you...

speaker: Siobhan
line: ...As you see, I'm entertaining my guests. Don't make me repeat myself.

speaker: Amiky
line: Fine... If you don't come along, I'll just sit here and not go anywhere else. Give me a sparkling drink, sweet, with extra ice.

speaker: Siobhan
line: Just one moment.

speaker: March 7th
line: What's her deal...? We can't discuss the case with other people hanging around the bar.

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), can you do that clockwork trick of yours again...?

text: Just what I've been waiting for.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Time is running out. We need to hurry.

speaker: March 7th
line: Yeah, I'm counting on you.

speaker: Amiky
line: You're one of Siobhan's guests, right? What can I do for you? If you're here to convince me to leave, please stop it. I'll never leave until she accepts my proposal...

speaker: Amiky
line: I just don't get why she won't leave this place... this run-down shack with no customers whatsoever.

text: Siobhan just said, "Anything can be imbibed"... Perhaps you can try various experiments to see what different emotions can brew with different drink ingredients .

children.speaker: Amiky
children.line: Ah, forget it. I'll just stay here and wait until she changes her mind.

speaker: Amiky
line: I've seen it... the moment when Siobhan and I share the stage.

speaker: Amiky
line: The crowd is going wild, applause crashing like waves. The aroma of irises fills the air, a beautiful melody playing, ribbons dancing around us. And the taste... is sweeter than honey.

speaker: Amiky
line: I've seen that scene countless times in my dreams, and every time, it mesmerizes me. That's why I have to bring her back to that world, no matter what it takes.

speaker: Amiky
line: Want to raise a glass, my attentive listener? Let's consider it... a toast to my far-fetched dream.

text: Amiky poured Pika White Grape Soda into your tall glasses. The rims gently clinked, emitting a crisp, resonant sound.
(If the player has not yet tuned to three different emotions)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (She's still not leaving... Maybe I'll have to try again.)

speaker: Amiky
line: ...It's ridiculous, right? Our paths were never meant to cross, yet I'm still holding on to her...

speaker: Amiky
line: I'm too timid and shy, longing to shine but afraid of stepping into the spotlight. I need her guidance, because I'll never be able to do anything alone...

speaker: Amiky
line: You don't know Siobhan's past, and you have no clue how... radiant she used to be. Even among the talented Iris Family, her skill was unmatched.

speaker: Amiky
line: I know... she probably thinks I'm just trying to ride her fame to get ahead, but all I want is for her to reclaim her place...

text: You feel an inexplicable mix of bitterness and sweetness that permeates the air. The next moment, that emotion turns into liquid filling your goblet.
(If the player has not yet tuned to three different emotions)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (She's still not leaving... Maybe I'll have to try again.)

speaker: Amiky
line: Those darn Iris jerks! They're the ones who forced Siobhan into hiding here, running this pesky bar... It's all their dirty scheming!

speaker: Amiky
line: Ah... I get it now. She's not leaving because she doesn't want to run into them again!

speaker: Amiky
line: I... I can help clear the way for her. I can do her a favor! I'll go back and write a letter to the Dreammaster, exposing the crimes committed by the Iris Family... Siobhan will definitely appreciate it!

text: (If the player has not yet tuned to three different emotions)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Things might get out of control if she gets any angrier... I need to come up with another plan.)

speaker: Amiky
line: Well... talking to you has got me feeling a bit down. My thoughts are swirling, making my mind clear and bringing tears to my eyes...

speaker: Amiky
line: Maybe... I should find a place to reflect on what Siobhan truly means to me...

speaker: Amiky
line: Here's the payment for the drinks. Please pass it on to her. I'm leaving now.

speaker: Siobhan
line: ...Amiky has left?

speaker: Siobhan
line: *sigh* That's good for her... Radiant dreams may be enticing, but they're nothing more than dreams. Her drink is on the house. Please keep the money.

speaker: Siobhan
line: When you're ready, go to Gallagher. I can tell he's itching to show off his skills.

speaker: Siobhan
line: And let me tell you, don't underestimate the bartenders of Penacony, especially not Gallagher. This guy is pure magic... He can satisfy even the pickiest of customers.

speaker: Siobhan
line: Don't go easy on this old man. Give him a real challenge.

text: Talk to Gallagher and have him prepare a drink for you

speaker: Gallagher
line: That being said, mixing a drink is way simpler than you'd imagine. Just pick your favorite ingredients, toss them in a glass, mix it up, and it's done.

speaker: Gallagher
line: So go ahead, explore the bar and bring me any ingredients you prefer.

text: I've gathered all the ingredients I need.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Nice work. Let me take a look...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Go ahead, my friend. I'm sure you'll find splendid ingredients.

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...You've found some interesting ingredients there. Now, take your pick.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Each drink has its own unique flavor, and the base ingredient sets the tone for the initial taste and the lingering aftertaste. So, which one would you like to use as the base ?

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Heh, you won't find a sweeter drink anywhere in Penacony, and that's what today's dream seekers crave.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Sweeter than Sousa Juice and more bitter than Dream Syrup. "Dream in a Bottle" — that's a metaphor for Penacony itself.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: The original formula is said to be Hanunue 's favorite drink. It's sour and bitter, and the bubbles burst in your throat like swallowing rusty chains, evoking thoughts of dungeons and prisons.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Now that you've chosen the base, it's time to pick the adjunct — the ingredient that'll create a marvelous chemical reaction with the base. It should give an unforgettable taste without overpowering the main tone. So, what's your choice for the adjunct ?

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Bright Future... a taste that's been a long time coming.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: I'll never forget the flavor that danced on my tongue as Mikhail whisked me through the Dreamscape wilderness. Those were haunting times... too beautiful to be real.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: This is the most pungent adjunct we have... and my personal favorite.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Before Mikhail left, the wrinkles at the corners of his eyes had deepened, like knife cuts. He mumbled, his breath too weak to climb up his throat, caught up in his chest. But I could smell it... the lingering scent of Penacony itself on that night.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: The taste is... not very intense, yet evocative.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: After those despicables sent Mikhail away, I found myself lost in the wilderness of my dreams. They say that even the dirt here oozes with sweetness... Heh, all I tasted was stoic bitterness.

speaker: Himeko
line: Mikhail...?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Almost there. Let's pick a decoration. Which style do you prefer? Anything you need, I've got it.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Concentric circles ... May you always remember where you started.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: A symbol of bravery and dauntlessness. May you break free from your shackles just like he did.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: The IPC 's favorite... Ambitious, aren't you?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Well, it's done...

text: (If the player submitted Dream Syrup and Bright Future)

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Here's to you, dream seeker, with this glass of El Dorado...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: ...To golden dreams.

text: (If the player submitted Dream Syrup and High Stakes)

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Here's to you, sober one, with this glass of "a Dream Within a Dream"...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: ...To our forebearers who dug their own graves.

text: (If the player submitted Dream Syrup and Eternal Endurance)

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Here's to you, dreamer, with this glass of "The Premature Burial"...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: ...To bringing time to a standstill.

text: (If the player submitted Classic SoulGlad and Bright Future)

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Here's to you, lost sheep, with this glass of "The Big Sleep"...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: ...To the ghosts of the past.

text: (If the player submitted Classic SoulGlad and High Stakes)

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Here's to you, seeker of truth, with this glass of "Farewell, My Lovely"...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: ...To unfinished business.

text: (If the player submitted Classic SoulGlad and Eternal Endurance)

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Here's to you, watcher, with this glass of "The Long Goodbye"...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: ...To a bitter childhood.

text: (If the player submitted Pika White Grape Soda and Bright Future)

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Here's to you, the Nameless, with this glass of "A Ticket to the Boneyard"...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: ...To the dead and the dying.

text: (If the player submitted Pika White Grape Soda and High Stakes)

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Here's to you, innovator, with this glass of "Time to Murder and Create"...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: ...To great vengeance.

text: (If the player submitted Pika White Grape Soda and Eternal Endurance)

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Here's to you, Trailblazer, with this glass of "Even the Wicked"...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: ...To the sad truth.

speaker: Siobhan
line: Well done, Gallagher. You're not over the hill yet.

speaker: Gallagher
line: So, are you satisfied?

speaker: March 7th
line: The flavors... they're way more sophisticated than SoulGlad.

speaker: Himeko
line: The richness and layers of these flavors are a masterpiece, especially with the adjuncts. I can taste the spicy and sour notes with a hint of sweetness...

speaker: Himeko
line: I'm not entirely sure what it all means. Maybe Mr. Gallagher can shed some light on it?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Well, if you're expecting a profound answer, I'm afraid I'll disappoint you.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The imagery it implies is pretty straightforward... It's just a glimpse of what this dream truly tastes like. Nothing more.

speaker: Himeko
line: Does this "true taste" have anything to do with that Mikhail ?

text: I heard this name in my dream...

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Yeah, that name does sound familiar... When you got knocked out by that Masked Fool girl , (Trailblazer), I think I heard someone calling that name. Do you remember?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Heh... I was right about you. You guys seem to know quite a bit, and now there's no reason to hide anything from you anymore.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Let's dig deeper into the case, and of course... I'll tell you a story about Mikhail .

title: Step Description
content: Effortlessly, Gallagher presents you with an exquisite drink. Hopefully, the drink can keep your conversation with him from getting too boring.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Alright, let's start with what we know based on the clues The Family has. It seems that Firefly isn't a local or an invited guest. In other words... she's a stowaway.

speaker: Gallagher
line: She managed to fool me at first — my age must be getting the best of me. But here, on the Planet of Festivities, stowaways are a common sight. You're bound to run into one sooner or later. After the incident, the Hounds wasted no time searching for that girl in both the Dreamscape and reality.

speaker: Gallagher
line: But here's the thing... We only received bad news, and the trickiest kind at that.

speaker: Gallagher
line: She simply vanished , leaving no trace in the Dreamscape or reality, as if she had never come to Penacony at all.

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? Does that mean...

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: That's impossible. The problem now is not that she's dead , but that it's as if she had never existed in the first place .

text: Maybe things will turn out different than what we think?

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Different...? Are you suggesting that girl wasn't actually killed? Come on, aren't you a witness in this case?

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Haha, a clever metaphor... Um, you were making a metaphor, right?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Let me be frank... This case, actually... is unlike anything the Bloodhound Family has dealt with before.

speaker: Himeko
line: "Dealt with before"? So... "Death" does happen in Penacony, if I understand correctly?

speaker: Gallagher
line: You've witnessed it, so there's no need to hide. Even the shiniest city has its dark side. We're all adults here, surely I don't need to explain too much to you.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Confronting The Family based on that alone would be naive. Death may occur in sweet dreams — so what? Such events are highly unlikely and only affect a tiny number of people.

speaker: Gallagher
line: If you really want to delve deeper into this case, you need to understand the true "problem" with The Family.

speaker: Himeko
line: I guess it's time to tell the story of that "Mikhail."

speaker: Gallagher
line: You're very perceptive. The Astral Express has received that music box, too, right? Do you know the secrets it holds?

speaker: Himeko
line: There's a message. "...Witness the impossible in the realm of dreams, find the Legacy of the Watchmaker , Father of Penacony, and thus the answer to the question: Why does life slumber?"

speaker: Gallagher
line: That's the exact wording.

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, why are you laughing... Wait, did you write it? It's quite poetic.

speaker: Gallagher
line: No... but I'm the officer in charge of this case, and how could I not know?... I'm sure you must have noticed that this message didn't come from The Family. You might even have guessed that the relationship between The Family and the Watchmaker isn't as close as it seems?

speaker: Himeko
line: That's just our speculation. Actually, it's hard to believe that the Father of Penacony and its actual managers are at odds.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Now I can assure you that your speculation is absolutely correct.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The Family has considered the Watchmaker as an enemy for a long time, but the Hounds haven't been able to track him down, as he seems to be living only in the characters and stories he created.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Let me ask you a question: Have you ever wondered why The Family allowed the Watchmaker to send out such a ridiculous message to the outside world, inviting you here and causing chaos?

speaker: Himeko
line: So, you want to seize this opportunity to expose the Watchmaker?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Well, now you understand why the Oak Family authorized the Nameless to assist in the investigation but kept you in the dark, right?

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...Because the Watchmaker is not the legend of the Land of the Dreams at all. He's the most shameful stain in the history of Penacony , and he's the root cause of all the anomalies in the Dreamscape.

text: But what does this have to do with Mikhail?

speaker: Gallagher
line: You don't get it? Well, I mean...

speaker: Gallagher
line: ... Mikhail, the betrayer of The Family... He's the Watchmaker .

text: Head to the Clock Studios Theme Park

title: Step Description
content: To better get his story across, Gallagher decides to make things fun by taking everyone to Clock Studios Theme Park. Using the facilities there as tools, he will give you all a lesson on the history of Penacony... Everyone understands that you are exhausted, but they hope you won't doze off.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Here we are, Clock Studios Theme Park, the most popular entertainment center in Penacony.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wait, aren't we supposed to be discussing "The Watchmaker"? I would have expected you to take us to maybe a library or an archive room of sorts, but an amusement park...?

speaker: Gallagher
line: The culture of a city reflects its history in the most authentic way. To you, it's a fun place, but to me, it's a prison for the planet's past.

speaker: Gallagher
line: You know that Penacony used to be the IPC's prison planet, right? All the prisoners were brought here, helping the Garden of Recollection salvage the leaking memoria from the Macro Void...

speaker: Gallagher
line: The prolonged exposure to high concentrations of memoria caused a unique phenomenon. The dreams of countless prisoners intersected and overlapped, and people started meeting each other in their dreams, living lives that were almost identical to reality.

speaker: Gallagher
line: But everything has a price, and sweet dreams are no exception. In the end, the dream world was unable to alleviate the suffering of prisoners in reality. One of the prisoners broke free from the IPC's shackles and fought for freedom...

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...He is Hanu , the great leader of Dreamville, the great peacemaker, and the faithful companion of the underdogs.

text: So, the character " Hanu " is based on a real-life person?
So that Clockie cartoon is actually a documentary...

speaker: Gallagher
line: History is always written by the winners. However, it's undeniable that Clockie is an animation that draws from Penacony's actual history.

speaker: Gallagher
line: These characters not only exist in Dreamville but also in the distant past. Once you realize this... you'll understand why we're here.

text: Enter the Clock Studios Theme Park

speaker: March 7th
line: There are so many members of the Bloodhound Family around here...

speaker: Gallagher
line: They just received a lockdown order, supposedly from Sunday himself. Who knows what it's for.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Heh... so many of them... I've never seen anything like this, even when they're tracking down suspects.

text: Can you convince them to let us in?

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: We don't need to go in — we don't want to draw any unwanted attention inside. We can just talk here.

text: It's pretty impressive even from out here.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Well, it's a masterpiece from The Family after all. Besides the followers of the Preservation, The Family members are the best at creating mind-blowing marvels.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Let's find a quiet spot and continue our conversation.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The view here is great, right? We can see everything from here...

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...Including Clockie.

speaker: Himeko
line: If all the characters in the animation are based on characters in reality, then Clockie's counterpart is definitely the Watchmaker.

speaker: Himeko
line: In the animation, he's Hanu's partner and one of the founders of Dreamville. Does that mean the Watchmaker was personally involved in that war and sided with Asdana ?

speaker: Gallagher
line: It was a monumental war for freedom. Hanunue fought alongside a motley crew of Masked Fools, Nameless, History Fictionologists , Mourning Actors , Omen Vanguards ... even visitors from beyond the sky. In the end, they emerged victorious.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Among them was the person who would eventually be known as the Watchmaker.

speaker: March 7th
line: But if you do the math... doesn't that mean the Watchmaker was around for several centuries?

speaker: Gallagher
line: I'm not sure, but Mikhail was already the Watchmaker when I met him, so maybe he inherited the title.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...How old are you now, Mr. Officer?

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...I'm thirteen.

speaker: March 7th
line: No way! Not even close!

speaker: Gallagher
line: Hanunue freed the frontier prison, but peace still eluded him. With limited resources, threats from the outside world, and internal conflicts between major prison districts, the future of Asdana was uncertain.

speaker: Gallagher
line: It wasn't until the Watchmaker approached The Family with the idea of turning the prison into the Planet of Festivities... that Penacony finally gained its name and glory.

speaker: Himeko
line: Thus he became known as the Father of Penacony.

speaker: March 7th
line: But didn't you say the Watchmaker betrayed The Family? And you said you were his companion, so that means you...

speaker: Gallagher
line: No, I'm not his "companion," but rather one of his many "children."

speaker: Gallagher
line: But I am indeed a traitor. Not to The Family, but to... Mikhail.

speaker: Himeko
line: ...What did you do?

speaker: Gallagher
line: I did nothing... and that's the worst betrayal of all.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Just like you, I had close companions. We dedicated ourselves to Penacony, but the Oak Family ... they set us up.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Mikhail was too old to protect his children anymore, so we left The Family to find our own path. We were branded traitors of the Harmony, even though the true traitors were someone else.

speaker: Gallagher
line: While they continue to praise the Watchmaker's name to the world, behind closed doors they condemn him on a pillar of shame.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Nevertheless, we wanted to clear his name. We intended to find the real traitor, the one responsible for all this, and restore Harmony to Penacony...

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...But we failed. Too much time had passed, and the Land of the Dreams had become deeply corrupted. After countless fruitless pursuits, I gave up... like a lost dog.

speaker: Gallagher
line: The Family accepted me and made me an officer, supposedly as a form of forgiveness, but it was actually a punishment. Since then, I've been completely cut off from my partners... and my past. As for Mikhail...

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...I heard he died in obscurity, in a place where no one could find him. That's when I realized that the Penacony I once knew would never return.

speaker: Himeko
line: We're truly sorry for what happened... but this is not the end of the story, right?

speaker: Gallagher
line: Hmm... Apparently, someone has inherited the title of the Watchmaker and has been secretly working against The Family all this time.

children.speaker: Gallagher
children.line: Well, that's one way to look at it. However, only one member has truly inherited the Watchmaker's title.

speaker: Gallagher
line: Unfortunately, after all these years, I have no idea who that person is, or if they're even real... or just Mikhail's lost soul haunting the dreams.

speaker: Gallagher
line: So, do you understand why I'm spilling all this info...? Because I believe the girl's death must be connected to the Watchmaker's Legacy, and at the end of all these mysteries...

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...We will find the answers we are seeking.

speaker: Gallagher
line: If it really is Mikhail's ghost, I want to meet him, if only for the last time. Those who despise me could form a line from here all the way to the entrance of the hotel, but those willing to look me in the eye and hear me out... Let's just say, there won't be many.

speaker: Gallagher
line: I've told you all I know as a sign of gratitude. Thank you for listening to this old dog — bark and all.

speaker: Gallagher
line: ...Hmm? Something just happened at the theme park... Now, if you'll excuse me. Good luck to all of you.

speaker: Gallagher
line: How ironic. What's so different between the stowaways rejected by Penacony today and the dream seekers once hailed as pioneers several Amber Eras ago?

speaker: March 7th
line: Gallagher... does have a troubled past, it seems.

speaker: Himeko
line: While Firefly's whereabouts remain a mystery, his stories shed light on our suspicions about the true identity of the Watchmaker, his connection to The Family, and the power struggles hidden behind sweet dreams and death.

text: And that... The Family isn't all "united as one".

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Exactly. Gallagher suggests that the real traitor is someone else... probably within the Oak Family.

text: And that... "Death" is related to the Watchmaker.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: That lines up with what we've gathered so far. Firefly got involved in this mess because of the Legacy... And now we're sure that Aventurine 's accusations against Acheron are baseless.

text: And that... Clockie is based on the Watchmaker.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...You're really into Clockie, huh? He's just a fictional character, not a real person!

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: ▶ Speaking of which, that Clockie who only reveals himself to (Trailblazer) is quite intriguing... It's a shame we've never met him since then.

text: That pretty much sums it up.

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ Now that we've confirmed a lot of our suspicions, let's take a moment to think about the clues we have. (Trailblazer), send a message to Welt and see how things are going on his end.

text: Messages The Astral Express Family Ask about Welt's situation. (Trailblazer) Mr. Yang, our investigation here has come to an end How's progress going on your end? Welt Not too bad. The Galaxy Ranger and I agree that The Family might be hiding something extremely important. We're now headed to Dewlight Pavilion. March 7th Acheron, huh? Didn't Aventurine say she was dangerous... Welt I've confirmed that she's on our side. Don't worry. Please wait for a while. I'll keep you posted as soon as I find anything.
Acheron and Welt have reached an understanding, directly targeting The Family with their suspicion. What will they discover at Dewlight Pavilion?
